meanings.definition: To gradually reduce or decrease in stages.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to phasedown its production to save costs.
meanings.sent2: They will phasedown the number of employees over the next few months.
meanings.sent3: The slow phasedown of the music volume made the party feel calmer.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, nature seemed to phasedown its bustling activities.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a timer to phasedown the time for each activity in class.

meanings.definition: A gradual reduction or decrease in stages.
meanings.sent1: The phasedown of the company's operations was planned carefully.
meanings.sent2: We are currently experiencing a phasedown in our energy consumption.
meanings.sent3: The phasedown of the cake size left everyone craving for more.
meanings.sent4: The phasedown of the crowd's noise revealed the distant sound of waves.
meanings.sent5: The phasedown of the city lights allowed the stars to shine brightly in the sky.
